intro: Phyteuma betonicifolium var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy betonicifolium phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine, soft hairs, giving the plant its "hairy" designation. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, moist soils. This perennial plant is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed sites, showcasing its adaptability to various habitats.
